Turnip Expressions

Turnip Expressions is a more human-friendly alternative to Regular Expressions. They were first introduced by Jonas Nicklas in the turnip tool.

Cucumber (soon) supports Turnip Expressions in Step Definitions. This document is both an introduction to Turnip Expressions and a specification to be used by implementors of Turnip Expressions in various programming languages.

Automatic type conversion

Itâ€™s common in Cucumber to capture strings and numbers. In dynamic languages like Ruby, the value of a capture group (\d+) will always be a string, and the user has to call to_i to convert it to an int. Turnip Expressions could be smarter about this if we used a different token to denote type:


Given 'I have $n cukes in my :thing' do |n, thing|
  # n is a Fixnum
  # thing is a String
end
